summary: This document is an email chain between Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, and an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, regarding scheduling a conversation and discussing the trial date preferences for a witness (likely a victim) in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The witness prefers an early September trial date due to an impending adoption with a baby due in early November.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney corresponding with the U.S. Attorney's Office about scheduling and witness preferences for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case referenced in the email chain (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).

connections.description: McCawley is an attorney involved in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, likely representing a party with an interest in the proceedings.

events.title: Preferred Trial Date for Witness
events.description: A witness (represented by Sigrid McCawley) strongly prefers the trial to be scheduled for early September 2021 due to personal circumstances involving an adoption.

events.title: Expected Birth of Adopted Baby
events.description: The birth mother of a baby being adopted by the witness and her husband is due in early November 2021, influencing the witness's trial date preference.

keyFacts: The email chain is regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
Sigrid McCawley, a partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, is communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office about witness scheduling.
A witness (whose name is redacted) strongly prefers an early September 2021 trial date because she and her husband are in the process of adopting a baby due in early November.
The correspondence shows coordination between defense/victim counsel and prosecutors regarding trial logistics in the Maxwell case.
